summary: This is a grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to Bank of America, dated October 15, 2019, demanding extensive financial records. The subpoena is part of an official criminal investigation into suspected felonies, including violations of sex trafficking and related statutes. It includes a request for non-disclosure to preserve the confidentiality of the investigation.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: Issued and signed the grand jury subpoena as the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York.

events.title: Grand Jury Appearance Date
events.description: The subpoena commands Bank of America to appear before the grand jury at the U.S. Courthouse in New York to testify and produce records.

events.title: Subpoena Issuance
events.description: The grand jury subpoena is issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office, initiating a formal demand for financial records from Bank of America.

locations: Silvio J. Motto Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
Bank of America N.A. Legal Order Processing, Christiana IV, 800 Samoset Drive, Newark, DE 19713
United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, Manhattan, New York, NY
keyFacts: The subpoena is issued in connection with an official criminal investigation of a suspected felony being conducted by a federal grand jury.
The investigation involves alleged violations of federal criminal law, specifically 18 U.S.C. §§ 1591 (sex trafficking), 1594(c), 2422(b) (coercion and enticement), and 371 (conspiracy).

The subpoena demands a comprehensive set of financial records from Bank of America, including account documents, wire transfers, safe deposit records, credit card statements, and online banking information.
The U.S. Attorney's Office requests that Bank of America voluntarily refrain from disclosing the existence of the subpoena to any third party to preserve the confidentiality of the investigation.
The document indicates the investigation was active as of October 2019, focusing on financial records to uncover evidence related to the specified criminal statutes.
